intro: Cladium iridifolium, commonly known as the iridescent rush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that often exhibit a striking iridescent sheen. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that produce small, three-lobed flowers, typical of the sedge family. Cladium iridifolium plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
